thread.title: Phil Donato maiden speech: Shooters, Fishers and Farmers MP lets fly at ‘out of touch’ | Daily Telegraph
thread.title_full: Phil Donato maiden speech: Shooters, Fishers and Farmers MP lets fly at ‘out of touch’ | Daily Telegraph

title: Phil Donato maiden speech: Shooters, Fishers and Farmers MP lets fly at ‘out of touch’ | Daily Telegraph
text:
NEW Shooters, Fishers and Farmers MP Phil Donato has entered Parliament with all guns blazing, using his maiden speech to blast the botched greyhound ban and council mergers as the decisions of an “arrogant and out-of-touch government”. 
He gave both barrels to the Greens and “animal liberationists”, saying they threaten the future of farming. 
Mr Donato also has the state’s dire road toll in his crosshairs, calling for better driver training and describing the state of some NSW roads as “embarrassing”. media_camera Phil Donato says the “vast majority” of greyhound owners are law-abiding, responsible citizens.” Picture: Wesley Monts 
The sports shooter and hunting enthusiast also wants tougher sentencing to curb the illegal gun trade in NSW. 
“The government of the day has the mandate to run this state — I will not obstruct them in exercising this mandate,” Mr Donato said in an advance copy his maiden speech, to be delivered this afternoon. 
“However ... I will obstruct, I will protest, and as you can probably already tell I will not hold any punches back if the people of Orange are getting a raw deal.” 
The former frontline cop snatched the seat of Orange from the Nationals in a stunning by-election victory last year, fuelled by anger over the dishlicker ban and plans to merger Orange Council with Blayney and Cabonne. 
Mr Donato lashed the state government’s dogs debacle and the council mergers, saying the policies “smacked of an inner city decision made by elitist, out-of-touch politicians at the expense of regional communities and jobs”. media_camera The Baird government’s amalgamation of councils was a topic firmly on Phil Donato’s agenda. Picture: Will Tuck (SOCC) 
“I am not so naive to not recognise that my election to this place was largely affected by two key policy decisions of this government — the greyhounds ban and forced council amalgamations,” Mr Donato said. 
“It is not just the decisions themselves that are significant. It is what they represented: an arrogant and out-of-touch government. 
“They were a reflection on poor government decision-making. 
“To think that the people of NSW would just roll over and cop something like that is as ignorant as it is dangerous.” 
The Berejiklian government is expected to table legislation soon repealing the greyhound ban and implementing a series of new measures to reform the industry. 
“I, like the majority of you, had no vested interest in greyhound racing when the decision was announced to shut down the industry via Facebook by former Premier Baird,” Mr Donato continued. 
“I distinctly remember listening to the Big Sports Breakfast program early one morning when the ban was announced, and thinking, ‘why?’ Philip Donato thanks Orange voters 0:25 
Philip Donato thanks residents who have voted in the Orange By-Election. Video supplied by Shooters, Fishers and Farmers Party. November 13th 2016
